resources: Which of the following statements below is always TRUE? Which one of the following will shift the supply curve for Good X to the left? "Good X is an inferior good. A fall in consumer income when the supply curve for Good X is positively sloped will cause which one of the following?" In relation to insurance, the term moral hazard suggests: "Assuming that the marginal and average cost curves are unchanged then, following a shift in the demand curve to the right, firms in a perfectly competitive industry will:" The profit maximising output for a monopoly is at the point where the: Which one of the following is NOT a barrier to entry into a monopoly market? "A firm is selling 1,000 units of output at a price of £20, with a marginal cost of £5 and average variable cost of £8 at that level of output. What is the supernormal profit that the monopoly firm is making?" Which one of the following statements about market structures is FALSE? Under the Cournot model of duopoly, a firm: "Which one of the following is NOT one of the four phases associated with the product life cycle theory?" "Which one of the following definitions is most compatible with the Basel III definition of capital adequacy?" "Which of the following will result in a deterioration in the domestic country’s terms of trade?" "Which one of the following is most likely to be the best method of reducing long term structural unemployment?" If a country has a current account surplus then: "A country with a population of 20 million has 15 million in employment and 1 million unemployed. What is the unemployment rate?" "Which of the following could explain why a country’s aggregate demand curve might shift outwards to the right?" The business cycle is defined as: "If the rate of inflation is higher than the anticipated rate used for negotiating interest rates and wages:" "Other things being equal, an increase in the level of real output in an economy will result in:" "An unexpected fall in the price level which causes a temporary rise in the real wage rate may:" The accelerator theory implies that: "As a result of a change in economic policy, interest rates and consumption rise but investment falls. The new policy is most likely to have been:" "The introduction of an expansionary monetary policy in an open economy operating with a flexible exchange rate would most likely lead to:" "Which of the following is a supply side economic policy aimed at promoting economic growth?" "Which one of the following will NOT happen following a devaluation of the domestic currency on the foreign exchange market?"
